metadata.description: The time zone for the VMs
20:00: The time the VM should shutdown.
The name of existing Virtual Network
The name of the existing subnet in the VNET
Optional: Name of existing availability set for the VM
The computer name for the new VM.
20:00: The time the VM should shutdown.
UTC: The time zone of the vmShutdownTime.
Optional: The email address the shutdown notification should go to.
The IP address for the new VM
The name of the admin account for the VM
The name of the admin FQDN for the VM
The password for the Administrator account of the new VM
The size of the VM Created
Windows Server Version
Windows Server Version
The Storage type of the data Disks.
Should the Azure VM guest service wait for the DNS service to start
By default, the VM is not assigned a PIP

settings.commandToExecute: powershell.exe -Command "Set-DnsClientServerAddress 'Ethernet' -ServerAddresses ('168.63.129.16'); Clear-DnsClientCache; if (!(Test-Path -PathType Container -Path c:\tools\labsetup)) { New-Item -Path C:\Tools\labsetup -ItemType Directory }; Get-DnsClientServerAddress | Out-File c:\Tools\labsetup\setup.log -encoding default; Invoke-WebRequest -Uri https://github.com/dloder0/SecPrac/raw/main/toolstest.zip -OutFile c:\tools\labsetup\setup.zip; if (Test-Path -PathType Leaf -Path c:\tools\labsetup\setup.zip) { Expand-Archive -Path C:\Tools\labsetup\setup.zip -DestinationPath C:\Tools\labsetup -Force; if (Test-Path -PathType Leaf -Path c:\tools\labsetup\invoke-setup.ps1) { & c:\tools\labsetup\invoke-setup.ps1 }}"
